mdRecord.dcterms:title: Dr. W.H. Coffin's medicine chest
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Coffin & Company Druggists [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Chest contains: 10 labeled medicine bottles: quinine, calomel, carbonate magnesia, 2 camphorated soap linament chloroform, 2 cream of tarter bitarterate of potassa, carbonate of ammonia, 2 cholera and dysentery mixture; 3 empty bottles; 6 bottles without labels; Rheubarb with extended description and dosage information; 1 tube; 1 apothecary scale balance; 2 apothecary scale pans; tourniquet; 3 bottle stoppers; a round piece of glass; and a stone wrapped in paper. [original]
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: medical instruments or apparatus
